messages: edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (20:21): i think the w3schools stuff was based on html5-diff
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:28): http://www.laroseweb.com/calcs/fans.php is aesome
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:28): awesome
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (20:28): b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f, I put some logo in place until yours is ready to be used
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (20:29): b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f, the current one is 160x160 fwiw
b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f (20:29): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: k, I guess a png one would be more useful
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:30): wtf is the <math> in http://articulo.mercadolibre.com.mx/MLM-19037478-cajon-con-bajo-mtx-thunder-12-bajo-descompuesto-_JM for
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (20:30): b07211a0c7cb119232799d2119cea90f, probably, unless we want to make this Opera 9.5 only
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (20:31): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, triggering the right font maybe?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (20:31): that markup is sad btw
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:42): ok, list of HTML elements updated
f4f1003ab53840254ccb8af51c1e02b3 (20:46): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: so I like the idea about having "cached" fire when all the resources in the manifest have finished loading
f4f1003ab53840254ccb8af51c1e02b3 (20:46): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: regardless of any implicit resources
f4f1003ab53840254ccb8af51c1e02b3 (20:47): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: however, what should happen if the URL to the implicit resource is in the manifest?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (20:48): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, is <font> used inside <svg> in an HTML way?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (20:49): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, if it only affects <math> it might make sense to just scope it to that
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:52): 84689f38c388923534f7a36f04cf6fc7: step 20.2 requires you to fetch teh resource before you continue
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:52): 84689f38c388923534f7a36f04cf6fc7: that can share the same network fetching attempt as the original one, but either way, it has to be fetched first
84689f38c388923534f7a36f04cf6fc7 (20:54): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: there is a similar issue in step 2 of
84689f38c388923534f7a36f04cf6fc7 (20:54): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: "If the resource being loaded was not loaded from an application cache, but it was loaded using HTTP GET or equivalent"
84689f38c388923534f7a36f04cf6fc7 (20:54): in the selection process
84689f38c388923534f7a36f04cf6fc7 (20:55): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: where the implicit resource might be in the cache, and might or might not have been fetched
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:57): i don't follow

84689f38c388923534f7a36f04cf6fc7 (20:58): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: the part about "store the resource in the matching cache with the most up to date version, categorised as an implicit entry"
84689f38c388923534f7a36f04cf6fc7 (20:59): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: what if that resource is already in the cache
84689f38c388923534f7a36f04cf6fc7 (20:59): should it be replaced?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:59): the cache selection process implies it's a top-level resource
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:00): if a top-level resource is in any cache anywhere, it'll be fetched from the cache, not the network
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:00): so you'll never get there in that situation
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:00): you'll hit one of the previous two items in the cache selection process
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:01): but there is one case that isn't covered
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:01): which is if the resource isn't listed in the manifest
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:01): so it's implicit
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:01): i've made a note to myself that i should update the spec to say that the 'cached' event doesn't fire until all the implicit resources are loaded too
84689f38c388923534f7a36f04cf6fc7 (21:04): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: what about updateready
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:05): same thing, yeah
